resources.string: The options below apply only to configurations whose "Auto-start Switch" is enabled in their own config.

When enabled, receiving the start broadcast (action: %1$s) will automatically start every configuration whose "Auto-start Switch" is on.

Example:
adb shell am broadcast -a %1$s io.github.acedroidx.frp

When enabled, receiving the stop broadcast (action: %1$s) will automatically stop every configuration whose "Auto-start Switch" is on.

Example:
adb shell am broadcast -a %1$s io.github.acedroidx.frp

When enabled, the broadcast may carry %2$s (frpc or frps) and %3$s (config file name) to start or stop only the specified config; otherwise it affects all configs with auto-start enabled.

Examples:

# Start frpc config named example.toml
adb shell am broadcast -a %1$s -e %2$s frpc -e %3$s example.toml io.github.acedroidx.frp

# Start frps config named server.toml
adb shell am broadcast -a %1$s -e %2$s frps -e %3$s server.toml io.github.acedroidx.frp

# Stop frpc config named example.toml
adb shell am broadcast -a %4$s -e %2$s frpc -e %3$s example.toml io.github.acedroidx.frp

# Stop frps config named server.toml
adb shell am broadcast -a %4$s -e %2$s frps -e %3$s server.toml io.github.acedroidx.frp
No Config. Click button to add one!
Select the type of frp to create
No templates found. Please check assets/examples.
This action will start the specified frp configuration. To use: Set variables in Tasker: • %frpType - \"frpc\" or \"frps\" • %configFileName - name of config file
No configuration files found. Please create a configuration first in the main app.
This app needs notification permission to show background service status. Please grant the permission to ensure proper functionality.
No Quick Tile Config selected. Please go to \"Settings - Quick Tile Config\" to select the frp configuration you want to start.
Allow other apps to read configs
Allow other apps to write configs
Expose config files via ContentProvider for read-only access. Enable only if you trust the requesting app; configs may contain sensitive tokens.
Allow other apps to modify config files via ContentProvider. Use with caution; unsafe writes may break frp connectivity.

Before using, turn on the "frp Config I/O" read/write switches in Settings and be aware of the possible disclosure of config passwords.

Examples:

# List all configs (requires "Allow read")
adb shell content query --uri content://io.github.acedroidx.frp.config

# Read a single config (requires "Allow read")
adb shell content read --uri content://io.github.acedroidx.frp.config/frpc/example.toml

# Write a single config (requires "Allow write")
# Overwrite the device config with local example.toml
adb shell content write --uri content://io.github.acedroidx.frp.config/frpc/example.toml < example.toml
Special thanks to the following contributors:
ahsaboy: added app icon, quick toggle, Tasker integration, and many optimizations
z156854666: added support for starting multiple frpc instances simultaneously
Notification permission is not granted, background notifications will not be shown.
No app available to open this config
To keep frp stable in the background, please complete these steps.

Notification permission is used to promote the background service to a foreground service to avoid being killed by the system.\n\nIf you find the notification bothersome, you can disable the frp background service notification in system settings without turning off the app notification permission.
Allow frp to ignore battery optimizations so the service is less likely to be killed.
Battery optimizations may stop background service
